Line Item description (company language): iPhone revenue consists of sales of Apple's iPhone line of smartphones, including various models such as the iPhone 16e, iPhone 17, iPhone Air, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max.
Services also include revenue from advertising, the App Store, and cloud services.

Wearables, Home and Accessories consists of Apple's line of wireless headphones (including AirPods, AirPods Pro, AirPods Max, and Beats products), spatial computing devices (Apple Vision Pro), home entertainment and smart speaker products (Apple TV 4K, HomePod, HomePod mini), and Apple-branded and third-party accessories.
Mac is the Company’s line of personal computers based on its macOS operating system, which includes both laptops and desktops.
iPad net sales include revenue from the sale of iPad devices, including models such as iPad Air, iPad mini, iPad, and iPad Pro.

Online stores revenue consists of sales of products to consumers through Amazon's online and mobile platforms, offering hundreds of millions of unique products sold by Amazon and third parties across dozens of product categories.

Third-party seller services consist of programs that enable sellers to grow their businesses, sell their products in Amazon's stores, and fulfill orders using Amazon's services. Amazon is not the seller of record in these transactions and earns fees for these seller programs.

AWS consists of a broad set of on-demand technology services provided to developers and enterprises of all sizes, including start-ups, government agencies, and academic institutions. These services include compute, storage, database, analytics, machine learning, and other services.
Advertising services consists of providing advertising solutions to sellers, vendors, publishers, authors, and others through programs such as sponsored ads, display, and video advertising.

Physical stores revenue consists of sales to consumers through the company's physical retail locations, offering a wide selection of products across dozens of categories designed for convenience and selection.
Google Search & other includes revenues generated on Google search properties, including revenues from traffic generated by search distribution partners who use Google.

Google Cloud includes infrastructure and platform services, applications, and other services for enterprise customers. Google Cloud revenues are comprised of Google Cloud Platform, which generates consumption-based fees and subscriptions for infrastructure, platform, and other services.

Google subscriptions, platforms, and devices revenues consist of consumer subscriptions (primarily from YouTube services such as YouTube TV, YouTube Music and Premium, NFL Sunday Ticket, and Google One), platform revenues (primarily from Google Play sales of apps and in-app purchases), device revenues (primarily from sales of the Pixel family of devices), and other products and services.
YouTube ads revenue consists of advertising revenues generated from ads shown on YouTube, including both brand advertising products and direct response advertising products.
Other Bets is a combination of multiple operating segments that are not individually material, and generates revenues primarily from the sale of healthcare-related services and internet services.

Advertising revenue in the Family of Apps (FoA) segment consists of revenue generated from selling advertising placements on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and third-party applications and websites, enabling marketers to reach people for various marketing objectives.

Reality Labs revenue is generated from the delivery of consumer hardware products, such as Meta Quest and Ray-Ban Meta AI glasses, and related software and content, including virtual, augmented, and mixed reality related consumer hardware, software, and content.

FoA Other revenue consists of revenue from WhatsApp Business Platform, Meta Verified subscriptions, net fees received from developers using the company's Payments infrastructure, and revenue from various other sources.

Server products and cloud services consists of Microsoft's public, private, and hybrid server products and cloud services, including Azure and other cloud services (such as cloud and AI consumption-based services, GitHub cloud services, Nuance Healthcare cloud services, and virtual desktop offerings), as well as on-premises server products like SQL Server, Windows Server, Visual Studio, System Center, and related Client Access Licenses.

Revenue Line: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services
Line Item description (company language): Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services consists of productivity, communication, and information services for commercial customers, including both cloud-based and on-premises offerings such as Microsoft 365 Commercial, Enterprise Mobility + Security, Exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance, Microsoft 365 Copilot, Windows Commercial, and Power BI.

Gaming revenue includes Xbox hardware and Xbox content and services, comprising first- and third-party content (including games and in-game content), Xbox Game Pass and other subscriptions, Xbox Cloud Gaming, advertising, and other cloud services.

LinkedIn connects the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful and transforms the way companies hire, market, sell, and learn. LinkedIn revenue includes offerings such as Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Premium Subscriptions, and Sales Solutions.
Windows and Devices includes Windows OEM licensing (Windows Pro and non-Pro licenses sold through the OEM channel) and Devices, comprising Surface and PC accessories.
Search and news advertising comprises advertising offerings across Bing and Copilot, Microsoft News, Microsoft Edge, and third-party affiliates.

Dynamics products and cloud services include Dynamics 365, which comprises a set of intelligent, cloud-based applications across ERP, CRM, Power Apps, and Power Automate, as well as on-premises ERP and CRM applications.

Enterprise and partner services includes Enterprise Support Services, Industry Solutions, Nuance professional services, Microsoft Partner Network, and Learning Experience, providing a range of support, consulting, and professional services to enterprise customers and partners.

Revenue Line: Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services
Line Item description (company language): Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services include Microsoft 365 Consumer subscriptions, Office licensed on-premises, and other consumer services designed to increase personal productivity and creativity through a range of products and services.

The 'Other' revenue line includes sales from various sources not classified under the main product and service categories, such as service and other revenue from cloud-based solutions, solution support, consulting services, online advertising, and LinkedIn.

The Compute & Networking revenue line consists of NVIDIA's data center compute and networking platforms for accelerated computing and AI solutions, including products based on the Hopper and Blackwell architectures.

This revenue line represents the operating income from NVIDIA's Compute & Networking segment, which includes products and platforms for accelerated computing and AI solutions, such as data center compute and networking platforms.

This revenue line represents the Compute & Networking segment, which includes products and solutions for accelerated computing, data centers, and networking infrastructure. It comprises sales to direct customers such as AIBs, distributors, ODMs, and OEMs.
